title: rclone config does not use --password-command when encrypting configuration

#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`

None.

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

Using `rclone config --password-command some-command` does not affect the initial encryption of rclone configuration performed from the `rclone config` menu under "s) Set configuration password".

The `changeConfigPassword` function in `fs/config/crypt.go` uses `ChangePassword` unconditionally, which in turn uses `GetPassword` unconditionally, which uses `ReadPassword` unconditionally - which uses either standard input or direct terminal I/O.

However the `Decrypt` function in `crypt.go` honors the `--password-command` (the `ci.PasswordCommand` obtained from configuration being used) and properly allows for using external programs to get the password value.

This can be used for offloading the password storage/generation into external hardware key or other protected password storage.

Currently, it is necessary to initially encrypt the configuration using direct terminal I/O or standard input only.

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

rclone v1.60.1-DEV

The same behavior can be seen on latest HEAD.

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)

Linux x86_64 (Ubuntu 22.04, 23.10 and 24.04, Debian 11 and 12).

#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)

Mostly related to the protecting the crypt remote key material. For completeness: the backing cloud storage is S3 backed by Ceph.

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

`rclone config --password-command 'zenity --password'`

This is NOT a suggested usage, however it shows the problematic behavior nicely.

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
2024/05/20 15:23:44 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.60.1-DEV" starting with parameters ["rclone" "-vv" "config" "--config" "configs/cesnet-clean.conf" "--password-command" "zenity --password"]
```
